intro: Barleria arnottiana, commonly known as the red barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive characteristic is its clusters of bright red, tubular flowers that bloom in summer. Barleria arnottiana is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
